about.about_text:
The Erketay Child Development Center has been operating for 6 years, helping children develop confidently, unlock their abilities, and feel special.

We use modern teaching methods, an individual approach, and create a warm, safe atmosphere for every child.

Our team consists of experienced specialists: speech therapists, defectologists, psychologists, and teachers who work with love and care.

Parents trust us and share warm reviews — because we see real results and progress in our students.

Erketay is a place where a child develops with joy!
about.individual_text: In our center, every child has their own development path. After the initial diagnosis, we create a personalized lesson plan taking into account age, diagnosis, development level, and family requests. The program includes speech therapy, neurocorrection, physical therapy, sensory therapy, and psychological support — in the right combination and rhythm.
about.methods_text:
• JASPER
• ABA therapy
• Sensory integration
• Neurocorrection
• Articulation and breathing exercises
• Adaptive physical education
about.care_text: In our center, every child is like family. We not only teach, but also accept, understand, and support. We notice moods, protect peace, and sincerely rejoice in every small success. At Erketay, the main thing is a warm atmosphere, trust, and care for the child's soul.

answers.My child is 2 years old but does not spe: This may be a speech development delay. Consult a specialist.
answers.Should I worry if my child does not spea: No need to panic, but do not wait. Do not delay getting help.
answers.He says 'mom', 'give', 'take' — is that: After 2 years old — not enough. Speech should develop into phrases.
answers.The child only says individual sounds. I: No. This is a pre-speech stage, speech stimulation is needed.
answers.He speaks in his own language. Is this n: After 2.5 years — no. This may be a sign of a speech disorder.
answers.The child speaks, but very unclearly. Is: After 3 years, speech should become clear. Otherwise, see a speech therapist.
answers.What is more important – sounds or words: Words are more important at first. Pronunciation of sounds develops later.
answers.Should I teach the alphabet if he does n: No. Focus on developing speech and thinking.
answers.Should I teach poems if he does not spea: Start with understanding speech, gestures, and play interactions.
answers.He understands everything but does not s: No. This may be an expressive speech delay.
answers.The child does not repeat after adults a: Sometimes — no. There may be a problem with understanding speech.
answers.Silent in kindergarten, but speaks at ho: May be selective mutism or strong shyness. Consult a psychologist.
answers.Can I just wait and see if he 'grows out: It is not worth waiting. Show the child to a specialist.
answers.Could there be a hearing problem?: Yes, be sure to check hearing with a specialist.
It could be either. Diagnosis is needed.
answers.Can speech delay be a sign of autism?: Yes, but not always. Other signs should also be assessed.
answers.He does not like touch, screams when dre: This may be sensory sensitivity. Consult a specialist.
answers.He flaps his hands, runs in circles. Wha: These may be stereotypies typical for autism.
answers.He repeats words but does not speak hims: This is echolalia. Work with a speech therapist is needed.
answers.He lines up cars but does not play story: This may be a sign of autism. Consult a specialist.
answers.He does not make eye contact. Is it alwa: No, but it is a worrying sign. Better to consult a specialist.
answers.What exercises can be done at home?: Breathing, articulation, and play exercises. Preferably with a specialist's recommendation.
answers.Can a sensory room be adapted for such a: Yes, sensory integration is useful for many children.
answers.He cannot tolerate loud sounds and brigh: Use headphones, avoid overload, consult a specialist.
answers.How to help a child with autism develop: Regular sessions with a speech therapist, support at home, sensory integration.
answers.Do boys start talking later than girls?: On average — yes, but the difference is small.
answers.Grandma says: 'you also spoke late.' Is: Heredity can influence, but does not always determine development.
answers.We speak two languages. Could that be th: Bilingualism does not cause speech delay, but may affect the pace.
